text:
Data cards

The baseline template for capturing data for sorting, sharing, and analysis in CLUE is a digital data card. A simple way is for students to create a card for each moth. Student groups then decide on the categories to add to their data cards based on their research question(s).

Data cards include a sorting function in the form of a pull-down menu. Students sort the cards into piles based on color, spots, or other pattern features.

CLUE also supports tables, and in fact, data card stacks and tables are interchangeable. Any data card stack can be used instantly to create a table and vice versa—via the tile's buttons. Each is a different way of representing the same data.

Once student groups have created data cards or a table, they can analyze their data by creating tables or graphs to answer research questions.

Show them how to click the buttons on the tile’s toolbar to copy data cards into a table, or a table into data cards. No need to build both! They can also graph data from either format using either the Bar Graph It! or the Graph It! (XY graph) button.

You can also create a graph tile using the buttons on the main toolbar. This will bring up an “empty” graph. Then, you add a dataset you choose. More information is in the User Guide.
